block.p: Elizabeth Hyland, a daughter of Karen Conant Hyland and John W. Hyland Jr. of New York, was married yesterday to David Fenton Bainbridge, a son of Kristin and Richardson Bainbridge of Weston, Conn. The Rev. Terrence W. Ryan performed the ceremony at the First Congregational Church in Sharon, Conn.

Mrs. Bainbridge, 28, graduated from St. Lawrence University and received a master's degree in social work last month from New York University. Her father is a partner in McFarland Dewey & Company, an investment bank in New York. He is also a director of Columbia University Teachers College and a former chairman of the American Academy in Rome. Her mother teaches the fifth grade at the Spence School in New York.

Elizabeth Hyland, a daughter of Karen Conant Hyland and John W. Hyland Jr. of New York, was married yesterday to David Fenton Bainbridge, a son of Kristin and Richardson Bainbridge of Weston, Conn. The Rev. Terrence W. Ryan performed the ceremony at the First Congregational Church in Sharon, Conn.

Mrs. Bainbridge, 28, graduated from St. Lawrence University and received a master's degree in social work last month from New York University. Her father is a partner in McFarland Dewey & Company, an investment bank in New York. He is also a director of Columbia University Teachers College and a former chairman of the American Academy in Rome. Her mother teaches the fifth grade at the Spence School in New York.

Mr. Bainbridge, 28, is a vice president for mergers and acquisitions, specializing in media companies, at Scott-Macon, an investment bank in New York. He graduated from Cornell University and is a candidate for an M.B.A. at New York University. His mother teaches the fourth grade at Rye Country Day School in Rye, N.Y. His father retired as an executive vice president for marketing for Oxford Industries, a clothing manufacturer, and is a marketing consultant to the March of Dimes, both in New York.
